channel.title: What are people doing?
channel.description:
I know that publicly-acknowledged bot systems are few and far between, but I'm curious about the current state of cheating theory. I know that ruler is using color-finding. I don't know how ARGA works (is it still alive?). Presumably pplsuqbawlz and semaphore have some methodologies that are far beyond the ken of mere mortals :P
If anyone with a working program is willing to give a general overview of their methods, I would appreciate it. Useful information would be things like are you hacking the loader (or [i]from[/i] the loader?), how far are you going to emulate a browser, does your program use information from the client to influence a human-interface-using program or do you hijack methods within client to perform actions? Runtime bytecode injection, download->static bytecode edit->run, or are any of you still using deobfuscated source in one way or another?
Bascially, I haven't looked at the new client for more than a few minutes since the day it was released and am looking to take advantage of any best practices that are already out there. Failing that, I'm looking for info on what has already been tried/accomplished so that I can avoid retracing someone else's development.

item.title: What are people doing?
item.dc:creator: @Your_Grandpa Your Grandpa
item.description:
@Your_Grandpa wrote:

I collected some mouse movement data a long time ago.
The structure of the .txt file is as follows:

time_in_milliseconds x y LeftMiddleRight_mousebutton

My results:

time: clicks 016 ms: 11 032 ms: 93 048 ms: 700 064 ms: 2720 080 ms: 4119 096 ms: 2137 112 ms: 527 128 ms: 95 144 ms: 20

Read full topic

item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Pwnd:

Mopar, you should actually have it record where the mouse goes on the entire screen. Make an invisible application, have the user minimize it, and go on that way =)

Thats useless, we simply need to know where it goes above the applet, and when and where it enters and exits.

item.title: What are people doing?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

So would anyone be willing to assist in this data gathering endeavor? I will of course share the data with everyone. We will probably want to write a small server to send the data to, and the server can either store it in a mysql database or write it to files. Any ideas and/or code will be appreciated.

Read full topic

item.title: What are people doing?
item.dc:creator: @Krichevskoy Krichevskoy
item.description:
@Krichevskoy wrote:

frank_:

yes, but they are all the same statistics…for example, im quite sure that you and i have different habits when using a mouse, sure it may not matter that much, but every little bit counts, right?

It’s all data…you can sort it into groups of behavior types, you can regress average curve equations from it (to get a representation of ‘human’ usage, individual tweaking is possible later), you can try mixing the speed of sample group A with that weird spiral thing that people in group B tend to do, et cetera. If you’re going to create a mouse movement package that mimics a range of human usage patterns, you need the research to test against - it’s not like anyone would be using the data as preset paths.

Read full topic

item.title: What are people doing?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

frank_:

yes, but they are all the same statistics…for example, im quite sure that you and i have different habits when using a mouse, sure it may not matter that much, but every little bit counts, right?

The point is people actually use MoparScape themselves and don’t just run it for the bot.

Read full topic

item.title: What are people doing?
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

frank_, if someone has a bot they won’t even play enough for 10 minutes ;| And if they’re not botting for that 10 minutes, you’ll probably get boo shit since they’re probably making a script.

And why would it be a problem to throw it into Moparscape? This data could be used for much more things.

I’m tired if you were wondering why I was talking so weird. Or, at least I think I’m talking weird.

Read full topic

item.title: What are people doing?
item.dc:creator: @frank frank_
item.description:
@frank wrote:

[quote=“moparisthebest, post:18, topic:22907”]But does it make sense to collect data from a bot that people wont be playing on themselves? that defeats the whole purpose, if actual human beings aren’t doing the input themselves then collecting data is useless.[/quote]you wouldnt even need 10 minutes to collect enough data to get ‘safe’ values, if you cant be bothered playing for that long in order to bot for hundreds of hours, you are just a lamer n00b

Read full topic

item.title: What are people doing?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“frank_, post:17, topic:22907”][quote author=moparisthebest link=topic=34999.msg462591#msg462591 date=1163593048]

I don’t think you understand frank_, we could use MoparScape to gather information such as Mouse Paths and mouse/keyboard patterns, such as timing clicks and keyboard presses etc etc. How would that be a problem? We couldn’t gather such statistics with a bot because no one would actually play on it.
[/quote]i know what you meant, you should just keep the projects unrelated. if you have the data collection as an option in the bot, it will be more individual and unique[/quote]

But does it make sense to collect data from a bot that people wont be playing on themselves? that defeats the whole purpose, if actual human beings aren’t doing the input themselves then collecting data is useless.

Read full topic

item.title: What are people doing?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“frank_, post:15, topic:22907”][quote author=moparisthebest link=topic=34999.msg462316#msg462316 date=1163583292]

Mopar, to find real people’s patterns, you should have something collect their mouse movements while they’re playing RS. With their consent, of course.

Just what I was thinking, perhaps I will put something like that into MoparScape and have a popup asking if it is ok.
[/quote]Kepp it totally away from moparscape, have it as a feature of the bot.[/quote]

I don’t think you understand frank_, we could use MoparScape to gather information such as Mouse Paths and mouse/keyboard patterns, such as timing clicks and keyboard presses etc etc. How would that be a problem? We couldn’t gather such statistics with a bot because no one would actually play on it.

Read full topic

item.title: What are people doing?
item.dc:creator: @Taios Taios
item.description:
@Taios wrote:

ARGA is still alive. We need to finish off Ground items. Fix getting the bank array, complete an auth system and its ready for a release in a beta state. ( The bot will be free)

It is done in bcel. We get the required information from the client and use it to calulate the screen positions of npc’s, object and eventually items. Inventory item stuff is done and it i suppose clicks like sbot3 atm. We will probaly have action hijacking for those wishing to use it.

Benland did us a nice new mouse aglothirim <3 <3.

Btw pwnd. If you use InstructionFinder. Things tend to break alot more.

Read full topic
